**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> Uncomment only one, leave it on its own line: 
>
/kind bug
> /kind feature


**What happened**:
I tried to use virtlet with Kubernetes release 1.6.6, but a pod with a VM in it gets stuck in "ContainerCreating" state.  This problem does not happen with Kubernetes release 1.6.3.
 The log of the responsible kubelet shows a panic when trying to restart the container.  I do not know why the container is being restarted, but that should not cause a panic in any case.  Here is an excerpt from the kubelet's log:
```
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: I0628 04:30:56.265647   91893 kuberuntime_manager.go:458] Container {Name:democirros-vm-pvc-1 Image:virtlet/volume/boot-volume Command:[] Args:[] WorkingDir: Ports:[] EnvFrom:[] Env:[] Resources:{Limits:map[memory:{i:{value:1073741824 scale:0} d:{Dec:<nil>} s:1Gi Format:BinarySI} cpu:{i:{value:1 scale:0} d:{Dec:<nil>} s:1 Format:DecimalSI}] Requests:map[memory:{i:{value:1073741824 scale:0} d:{Dec:<nil>} s:1Gi Format:BinarySI} cpu:{i:{value:1 scale:0} d:{Dec:<nil>} s:1 Format:DecimalSI}]} VolumeMounts:[{Name:boot-volume ReadOnly:false MountPath:/dev/vda SubPath:} {Name:default-token-xkr6n ReadOnly:true MountPath:/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount SubPath:}] LivenessProbe:nil ReadinessProbe:nil Lifecycle:nil TerminationMessagePath:/dev/termination-log TerminationMessagePolicy:File ImagePullPolicy:Always SecurityContext:nil Stdin:false StdinOnce:false TTY:false} is dead, but RestartPolicy says that we should restart it.
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: I0628 04:30:56.265713   91893 kuberuntime_container.go:545] Killing container "docker://virtlet__d5536480-16a1-49b4-54dd-624e0e093882" with 30 second grace period
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: E0628 04:30:56.265865   91893 runtime.go:66] Observed a panic: "invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference" (runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference)
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime/runtime.go:72
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime/runtime.go:65
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/vendor/k8s.io/apimachinery/pkg/util/runtime/runtime.go:51
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:479
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:458
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /usr/local/go/src/runtime/panic.go:62
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /usr/local/go/src/runtime/sigpanic_unix.go:24
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kuberuntime/kuberuntime_container.go:548
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kuberuntime/kuberuntime_manager.go:582
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kubelet.go:1561
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/kubelet.go:755
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/pod_workers.go:173
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/pod_workers.go:176
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/pkg/kubelet/pod_workers.go:214
Jun 28 04:30:56 n11rdu1comp1 hyperkube[91893]: /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:2086
```

It is easy to see a code path that can cause this panic.  The offending line in kuberuntime_container.go is this:
```
	if containerSpec.Lifecycle != nil && containerSpec.Lifecycle.PreStop != nil {
```
and there is indeed a way for `containerSpec` to be nil at this point.  Earlier in that function we see the line
```
		containerSpec = kubecontainer.GetContainerSpec(pod, containerName)
```
and there is no intervening statement that checks whether `containerSpec` is `nil`; `kubecontainer.GetContainerSpec` ends with `return nil`.

**What you expected to happen**:
I expected the virtlet to run, like it does with Kubernetes release 1.6.3.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
That would take some work, I hope the diagnosis above makes this moot.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
root@n11rdu1ctrl:~# kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.6", GitCommit:"7fa1c1756d8bc963f1a389f4a6937dc71f08ada2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-06-16T18:21:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"6", GitVersion:"v1.6.6", GitCommit:"7fa1c1756d8bc963f1a389f4a6937dc71f08ada2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-06-16T18:21:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: "bare metal" (really VMs, but who cares?)
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux n11rdu1ctrl 4.4.0-34-generic #53-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jul 27 16:06:39 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools: I installed Kubernetes and virtlet using some local Ansible
- Others: I am using a local fork of virtlet
